text: Any way to do surrogate optimization when you have both categorical and continuous factors? e.g. optimizing the yield of a chemical reaction, where you can pick between more than a 100 different ligands, and a continuous temperature range.

text:
Some more unrelated questions:
Are there any criteria to decide when it is a good point to stop. ie unlikely to find a better point

Are there any methods to roughly decide how many runs will be needed, perhaps after a few initial measurements.

If batched, are there any methods to estimate how batching decreases the performance compared to if all the measurements were done sequentially.

text: Not sure about batching. The optimization methods that I know of for surrogates do have stopping conditions depending on the method though. You could also add a stopping condition on the number of iterations, but it’s hard to choose it at the beginning
